net.sf.appia.protocols.group.suspect
Class Fail

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.Event
      net.sf.appia.protocols.group.events.GroupEvent
          net.sf.appia.protocols.group.suspect.Fail
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Fail
extends GroupEvent
implements java.lang.Cloneable

GroupEvent that notifies that one, or more, members of the group have failed.
The Event is sent by the suspect layer and contains a bolleans array, of the same size of the current view. Each postion in the boolean array corresponds to the same position in the view array. All the members that have failed since the last view change or Fail Event have their correspondent postion marked as true.
Notice that a failed member may have his position marked with false, if the failure was anouced by a previous Fail Event.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Alexandre Pinto
See Also:
SuspectLayer, SuspectSession, ViewState
